aspguidp.service.core.atom

Interface AtomHub

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleAtomHub

    public interface AtomHub
    Interface for an atom hub.

    An atom hub is responsible for passing atoms through the application. Therefore, AtomSupplier instances and AtomConsumer instances can register themselves to an instance of the atom hub. The atom hub instance then provides a method to get all atoms from the registered atom suppliers and a method to set a collection of atoms to the registered atom consumers. Usually, the application uses two atom hub instances; an input atom hub and an output atom hub.

    The input atom hub is used to set and access the atoms which are passed to the logic program as input. Every input component of the application registers its data manager as an atom supplier to the input atom hub (InputElementController, DataManager). When the logic program is executed, the atoms of these data managers are passed as input to the logic program. Additionally, the data managers of the input components of the applications are registered as atom consumers to the input atom hub. This enables to set the data of the input components when a problem instance is loaded.

    The output atom hub is used to set and access the atoms of the currently displayed answer set. The ProgramOutputController instance of the application registers itself as atom provider to the output atom hub and provides the atoms of the currently displayed answer set. Additionally, if the currently displayed answer set is changed, the atoms of new displayed answer set is set to the consumers of the output atom hub. Also, every output component of the application registers its data manager as an atom consumer to the atom output hub (OutputElementController, DataManager). So when the currently displayed answer set by the output controller, the atoms of the answer set are passed to the data managers of the output components.
